headline: Apple AI chief leaving as iPhone maker plays catch-up
summary: Apple on Monday said the head of its artificial intelligence team is stepping down, and the effort is to be led by a veteran engineer from Google and Microsoft.Subramanya was most recently a corporate vice president of AI at Microsoft, prior to that spending 16 years at Google where he was head of engineering for the Gemini digital assistant before leaving, Apple said.

content.title: Apple AI chief leaving as iPhone maker plays catch-up
content.summary: Apple on Monday said the head of its artificial intelligence team is stepping down, and the effort is to be led by a veteran engineer from Google and Microsoft.Subramanya was most recently a corporate vice president of AI at Microsoft, prior to that spending 16 years at Google where he was head of engineering for the Gemini digital assistant before leaving, Apple said.

thumbnail.caption: Apple says that Senior Vice President Machine Learning and AI Strategy John Giannandrea will retire early in 2026, acting as an advisor during his remaining time at the company (JUSTIN SULLIVAN)

headline: Samsung Debuts First Trifold Phone Ahead of Folding iPhone
summary: The handset, called the Galaxy Z TriFold, is part of a small subset of folding phones that have two hinges, allowing them to transform into larger, tablet-sized devices.  Samsung is initially launching it in South Korea on Dec. 12 with a price of 3.59 million won (about $2,450).  The TriFold will also be available in other markets, including China, Taiwan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates.

content.title: Samsung Debuts First Trifold Phone Ahead of Folding iPhone

Samsung is initially launching it in South Korea on Dec. 12 with a price of 3.59 million won (about $2,450).  The TriFold will also be available in other markets, including China, Taiwan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates.

headline: Apple's AI chief steps down as company falls behind in tech race
summary: Apple's head of artificial intelligence and machine learning has stepped down from the company.  John Giannandrea, the current senior vice president for machine Learning and AI strategy, will be replaced by former Microsoft AI executive Amar Subramanya.  Mr Subramanya has overseen the development of Gemini, Google's AI and spent two decades in the industry.

content.title: Apple's AI chief steps down as company falls behind in tech race
content.summary: Apple's head of artificial intelligence and machine learning has stepped down from the company.  John Giannandrea, the current senior vice president for machine Learning and AI strategy, will be replaced by former Microsoft AI executive Amar Subramanya.  Mr Subramanya has overseen the development of Gemini, Google's AI and spent two decades in the industry.

headline: OpenAI vs. Google: Why Sam Altman issued a 'code red'
summary: OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO, Sam Altman, reportedly issued a "code red" in an internal memo to employees on Monday, according to The Information, as the company's rivals continue to advance their artificial intelligence (AI) language learning models (LLMs), such as Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google Gemini 3. JonesTrading chief market strategist, Michael O'Rourke, joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss the "AI civil war." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: OpenAI vs. Google: Why Sam Altman issued a 'code red'
content.description:
OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO, Sam Altman, reportedly issued a "code red" in an internal memo to employees on Monday, according to The Information, as the company's rivals continue to advance their artificial intelligence (AI) language learning models (LLMs), such as Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google Gemini 3.

JonesTrading chief market strategist, Michael O'Rourke, joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss the "AI civil war."

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO, Sam Altman, reportedly issued a "code red" in an internal memo to employees on Monday, according to The Information, as the company's rivals continue to advance their artificial intelligence (AI) language learning models (LLMs), such as Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google Gemini 3. headline: OpenAI's 'code red' is a warning for the 'whole AI ecosystem'
summary: OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO Sam Altman reportedly declared a "code red" due to competitive pressures, following Alphabet's (GOOGL, GOOG) release of Google Gemini 3. Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye joins Opening Bid with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to explain why a "code red" at OpenAI "matters for all of us." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: OpenAI's 'code red' is a warning for the 'whole AI ecosystem'
content.description:
OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO Sam Altman reportedly declared a "code red" due to competitive pressures, following Alphabet's (GOOGL, GOOG) release of Google Gemini 3.

Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye joins Opening Bid with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to explain why a "code red" at OpenAI "matters for all of us."

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Why Nvidia, Google, and Uber still control the market
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast. In this episode of Stocks in Translation, Wall Street money manager David Miller joins host Jared Blikre and Senior Reporter Allie Canal, to break down the stocks with real market power heading into 2026. From AI giants like Nvidia and Google to high-moat businesses, aerospace leaders, and healthcare’s comeback names - Miller explains why monopolies and oligopolies keep outperforming. This episode dives into operating leverage, insider-buying signals, and whether the U.S. can dodge a recession. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service.

headline: What's a Waymo Anyway?
summary: Waymo is in expansion mode as competitors fail to get fully autonomous vehicles (without a safety driver) on the road. In this podcast, Motley Fool contributors discuss Waymo's approach and whether there's a sustainable lead in autonomy.

content.title: What's a Waymo Anyway?
content.summary: Waymo is in expansion mode as competitors fail to get fully autonomous vehicles (without a safety driver) on the road. In this podcast, Motley Fool contributors discuss Waymo's approach and whether there's a sustainable lead in autonomy.

headline: Amazon unveils new AI chip in battle against Nvidia
summary:
Amazon Web Services launched its in-house-built Trainium3 AI chip on Tuesday, marking a significant push to compete with Nvidia in the lucrative market for artificial intelligence computing power.The move intensifies competition in the AI chip market, where Nvidia currently dominates with an estimated 80- to 90-percent market share for products used in training large language models that power the likes of ChatGPT.
